bcl:part.bcl:text: Taxes in Relation to Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rates of tax in relation to purchase price

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, the rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 80, 80.3 to 80.6, 81 to 84, 85 and 86 on tangible personal property is 7% of the purchase price of the tangible personal property.
The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 81, 82, 82.2, 84 and 86 on liquor is 10% of the purchase price of the liquor.

Subject to subsections (3.1), (5), (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 50 (2) (a), 51 (6), 52, 81, 82, 82.2, 82.3, 83, 84, 85 and 86 on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 12% of the purchase price of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.
Subject to subsections (5), (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 50 (2) (a), 51 (6), 52, 81, 82, 82.2, 82.3, 83, 84, 85 and 86 on a passenger vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 12% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (5), (6) and (6.1) apply in relation to a vehicle, boat or aircraft if the person who must pay tax under the applicable section on the vehicle, boat or aircraft, or another person referred to in section 49 (1) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: acquired the vehicle, boat or aircraft at a sale in Canada that is a taxable supply under Part IX [Goods and Services Tax] of the Excise Tax Act by a registrant,
imported the vehicle, boat or aircraft from outside Canada, or
acquired the vehicle, boat or aircraft in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 50 (2) (a), 51 (6), 52 and 81 to 86 on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 7% of the purchase price of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.
The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 50 (2) (a), 51 (6), 52 and 81 to 86 on a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is less than $55 000;
8% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 50 (2) (a), 51 (6), 52 and 81 to 86 on a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is less than $75 000;
8% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 80, 80.3 to 80.6 and 82.2 on a manufactured mobile home is 7% of the amount equal to 50% of the purchase price of the manufactured mobile home.

The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 80, 80.3 to 80.6 and 82.2 on a manufactured modular home is 7% of the amount equal to 55% of the purchase price of the manufactured modular home.
The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52 and 82.2 on a portable building is 7% of the amount equal to 45% of the purchase price of the portable building.
Subsections (7) to (8.1) do not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: free-standing appliances, free-standing furniture and draperies sold with a manufactured building;
repair parts purchased for a manufactured building;
related services provided in respect of a manufactured building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 81, 82, 82.01, 82.1, 82.2, 83, 84, 85 and 86 on a vapour product is 20% of the purchase price of the vapour product.

The rate of tax payable under sections 37, 49 (6) (a), 51 (6), 52, 80, 80.3 to 80.6, 81 to 82.2, 83, 84, 85 and 86 on a fossil fuel combustion system is 12% of the purchase price of the fossil fuel combustion system.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rates of tax in relation to lease price

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, tax rate value,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a passenger vehicle other than a modified business vehicle or, subject to subsection (1.1), a modified motor vehicle, means, for so long as the lessor remains the owner of the passenger vehicle, the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the first date on which the lessor leases the passenger vehicle to any person,

in relation to a modified business vehicle, means, for so long as the lessor remains the owner of the modified business vehicle, the fair market value of the modified business vehicle on the first date on which the lessor leases the modified business vehicle to any person less the portion of that fair market value that can reasonably be attributed to the modifications referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of "modified business vehicle", and

subject to subsection (1.1), in relation to a modified motor vehicle that is a passenger vehicle, means, for so long as the lessor remains the owner of the modified motor vehicle, the fair market value of the modified motor vehicle on the first date on which the lessor leases the modified motor vehicle to any person less the portion of that fair market value that can reasonably be attributed to those special features or modifications of the vehicle for which the sole purpose is to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: facilitate the use of the vehicle by, or the transportation of, an individual using a wheelchair, or
equip the vehicle with an auxiliary driving control that facilitates the operation of the vehicle by an individual with a disability.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a modified motor vehicle that is a passenger vehicle is leased to a person, at the time the lease is entered into, for a period of less than one year, for the purposes of this section the tax rate value in respect of that lease of the vehicle must be determined as if the vehicle were not a modified motor vehicle.

Subject to this section, the rate of tax payable under sections 39 [tax on leases], 41 [tax if leased property used in British Columbia during rental period], 82.01 [tax if leased property used for new purpose] and 102 [tax on leased property occasionally supplied with operator] on tangible personal property is 7% of the lease price of the tangible personal property.
The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41, 82.01 and 102 on a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is less than $55 000;
8% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the passenger vehicle is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41, 82.01 and 102 on a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is less than $75 000;
8% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the lease price, if the tax rate value of the zero-emission vehicle is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41 and 82.01 on a manufactured mobile home is 7% of the amount equal to 50% of the lease price of the manufactured mobile home.
The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41 and 82.01 on a manufactured modular home is 7% of the amount equal to 55% of the lease price of the manufactured modular home.
The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41 and 82.01 on a portable building is 7% of the amount equal to 45% of the lease price of the portable building.
Subsections (4) to (6) do not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: free-standing appliances, free-standing furniture and draperies leased with a manufactured building;
repair parts leased for a manufactured building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41 and 82.01 on a vapour product is 20% of the lease price of the vapour product.
The rate of tax payable under sections 39, 41, 82.01 and 102 on a fossil fuel combustion system is 12% of the lease price of the fossil fuel combustion system.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Rates of tax in relation to gifts

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, the rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) is 7% of the fair market value of the tangible personal property on the entry date of the property.
The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on liquor is 10% of the fair market value of the liquor on the entry date of the liquor.

Subject to subsections (3.1), (5), (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 49 (6) (c) and 50 (2) (b) on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 12% of the fair market value of the vehicle, boat or aircraft on the entry date of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.
Subject to subsections (5), (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 49 (6) (c) and 50 (2) (b) on a passenger vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 12% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (5), (6) and (6.1) apply if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the donor who gave the gift to the person who must pay tax in accordance with section 49 (6) (c) or 50 (2) (b)

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a registrant under Part IX [Goods and Services Tax] of the Excise Tax Act, or
acquired the vehicle, boat or aircraft in prescribed circumstances, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person who must pay tax in accordance with section 49 (6) (c) or 50 (2) (b) imported the vehicle, boat or aircraft from outside Canada.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (6) and (6.1), the rate of tax payable under sections 49 (6) (c) and 50 (2) (b) on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 7% of the fair market value of the vehicle, boat or aircraft on the entry date of the vehicle, boat or aircraft.
The rate of tax payable under sections 49 (6) (c) and 50 (2) (b) on a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is less than $55 000;
8% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the entry date of the passenger vehicle, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under sections 49 (6) (c) and 50 (2) (b) on a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is less than $75 000;
8% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the entry date of the vehicle, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on a manufactured mobile home is 7% of the amount equal to 50% of the fair market value of the manufactured mobile home on the entry date of the manufactured mobile home.

The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on a manufactured modular home is 7% of the amount equal to 55% of the fair market value of the manufactured modular home on the entry date of the manufactured modular home.
The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on a portable building is 7% of the amount equal to 45% of the fair market value of the portable building on the entry date of the portable building.
Subsections (7) to (8.1) do not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: free-standing appliances, free-standing furniture and draperies given as a gift with a manufactured building;
repair parts given as a gift for a manufactured building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on a vapour product is 20% of the fair market value of the vapour product on the entry date of the vapour product.
The rate of tax payable under section 49 (6) (c) on a fossil fuel combustion system is 12% of the fair market value of the system on the entry date of the fossil fuel combustion system.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on purchase

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A purchaser who purchases tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia must pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under section 34.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a purchaser of tangible personal property, if the purchaser must pay tax imposed under Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] in relation to the tangible personal property;

a purchaser of a taxable conveyance, as defined in section 59, if the purchaser must pay tax imposed under section 60 [tax if conveyance purchased in British Columbia for interjurisdictional use] in relation to the taxable conveyance;
a purchaser of a vehicle, if the vehicle is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a) [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed];

a purchaser of an exclusive product, if the purchaser must pay tax imposed under section 99 (1) or (2) [tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor] in relation to the exclusive product;
a purchaser of a reusable container, if the purchaser must pay tax imposed under section 101 (1) [tax on reusable containers].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (7), if a collector sells tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the tangible personal property is being purchased for resale, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) as if the person were a purchaser and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector sells a vehicle at a sale in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the vehicle is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a), the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) of this section and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains from that person, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the account number assigned by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia to the person who licenses the vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector sells tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under section 79 (1) or 80.5 (6) from paying tax under subsection (1) of this section, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector sells tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under section 80.1 (1) or 80.5 (7) from paying tax under subsection (1) of this section, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number or, from that person, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director, and
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director and made by the party referred to in section 80.1 (1) (c) or 80.5 (7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector sells a vehicle at a sale in British Columbia to a person, that person is deemed to be a purchaser of the vehicle unless the person provides to the collector, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person's registration number, or
if the person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director that the vehicle is being purchased for resale.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (7) does not apply

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person is registered as a motor dealer under the Motor Dealer Act, or
in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of this Division
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division does not apply in relation to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a conveyance that is subject to tax or is exempt from tax under Division 6 [Conveyances Used Interjurisdictionally];

subject to section 39 (2) and (4), a multijurisdictional vehicle or a vehicle that is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a) [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on leases

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A lessee of tangible personal property must pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under section 35 [rates of tax in relation to lease price] if one or more of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lessee enters into the lease in British Columbia;
the tangible personal property is located in British Columbia at the time the lessee enters into the lease;
the lessee or any other person referred to in the definition of "lessee" takes or intends to take possession of the tangible personal property in British Columbia;
the lessee or any other person referred to in the definition of "lessee" receives delivery in British Columbia of the leased tangible personal property;
the tangible personal property is a vehicle that is registered for use in British Columbia under the vehicle registration legislation;
the lessee leases the tangible personal property in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies in relation to a short term rental vehicle leased to the lessee.
Subsection (1) does not apply to a lessee of tangible personal property if the lessee must pay tax imposed under section 40 in relation to the lease.

If a collector, as lessor, leases a vehicle to a person who alleges that the vehicle is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a), the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) of this section and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains from that person, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the account number assigned by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia to the person who licenses the vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on motor vehicle leased outside British Columbia and registered for use in British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, taxable value, in relation to a motor vehicle, means the fair market value of the motor vehicle on the date the motor vehicle is registered for use in British Columbia under the vehicle registration legislation.

If a lessee of a motor vehicle leases the motor vehicle for a period of more than 28 days from a person who is located outside British Columbia and registers the motor vehicle for use in British Columbia under the vehicle registration legislation, the lessee must pay to the government tax as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the motor vehicle is not a passenger vehicle, at the rate of 7% of the taxable value of the motor vehicle;
if the motor vehicle is a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, at the applicable rate as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 7% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is less than $55 000;
8% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the passenger vehicle is $150 000 or more;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the motor vehicle is a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, at the applicable rate as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 7% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is less than $75 000;
8% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the taxable value, if the taxable value of the zero-emission vehicle is $150 000 or more.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if leased property used in British Columbia during rental period

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a lessee of tangible personal property in relation to a rental period under the lease if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lessee brings or sends into British Columbia the tangible personal property,
the lessee

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a BC resident, or
uses the tangible personal property in British Columbia in the course of the lessee's business, whether or not the lessee's business is carried on in British Columbia, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property is for use or is used in British Columbia during the rental period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a lessee if the lessee must pay tax imposed under section 39 or 40 in relation to the lease.

A lessee to whom this section applies must pay to the government, in relation to the rental period under the lease, tax on the tangible personal property in the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the applicable rate under section 35 [rates of tax in relation to lease price];
the number of hours the tangible personal property is in British Columbia in the rental period;
the total number of hours in that rental period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of applying the applicable rate under section 35 in relation to the calculation under subsection (3) of this section, the lease price of the tangible personal property is that portion of the lease price that is attributable to the rental period.
Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the rental period ends.
Despite subsection (4), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if balance of lease price becomes due on breach of lease

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a lessee breaches a lease that provides for

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lease of tangible personal property that is subject to tax under section 39, and
the payment, on breach of the lease, of some or all of the outstanding balance of the lease price,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the lessee must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the amount of the payment referred to in paragraph (b) of this subsection.
Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraph (b) of this subsection, at the time the payment referred to in subsection (1) (b) becomes due under the terms of the lease, or

if the tax is not levied in accordance with subsection (4), on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the payment referred to in subsection (1) (b) becomes due under the terms of the lease.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (2), if the tax under subsection (1) is payable by a registrant and is not levied in accordance with subsection (4), the tax must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.
If a person must pay tax under subsection (1) and the tax is payable in accordance with subsection (2) (b), the person must file a taxpayer return with the director.

If the lessor is a collector and the tax under subsection (1) is payable in accordance with subsection (2) (a), the lessor must levy and collect the tax at the time the tax is payable in accordance with that subsection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Additional tax on lease of passenger vehicle

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to any tax payable under section 39, a lessee who leases a passenger vehicle must pay to the government, for the raising of revenue for the BC Transportation Financing Authority continued under the Transportation Act, tax at the rate of $1.50 for each day or portion of a day that the lessee leases the vehicle.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the passenger vehicle that is the subject matter of the lease is leased to the lessee for a period of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 8 consecutive hours or less, or
more than 28 consecutive days.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption if lease under sale and lease-back arrangement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under this Division if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property was sold to the lessor by the lessee under a sale and immediate lease-back arrangement, and
the lessee had, before the sale to the lessor,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax imposed under this Part in respect of the tangible personal property, other than tax imposed under section 51 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for temporary use] or Division 6 [Conveyances Used Interjurisdictionally], and for which the lessee has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under this Act,

paid tax imposed under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the tangible personal property and for which the lessee has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under those Acts, or

in respect of the tangible personal property, paid tax imposed under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under that Act, and for which the lessee has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector, as lessor, leases tangible personal property to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under subsection (1) from paying tax under this Division, the person must nevertheless pay tax under this Division and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under this Division unless the collector obtains from that person, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any information or document required by the regulations, and
any information or document required by the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund for leased property used outside British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lessee of tangible personal property paid tax under section 39, and
the tangible personal property was used outside British Columbia during a rental period,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must pay a refund to the lessee in accordance with subsection (2).

The amount of a refund under subsection (1) in respect of a rental period under the lease is equal to the amount of tax paid under section 39 that is in respect of the lease price attributable to the rental period less the amount of tax that would have otherwise been payable under section 41 in respect of the rental period if that section had applied to the lessee in respect of the rental period.
This section does not apply in respect of a lease of a motor vehicle registered for use in British Columbia under the vehicle registration legislation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund on motor vehicle leased outside British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: On termination or expiration of the lease for a motor vehicle referred to in section 40 (2), or on removal of the motor vehicle from British Columbia for registration outside British Columbia, the director may provide a refund to the lessee in the amount of the difference between the tax paid under section 40 at the time of registering the vehicle less the sum of all taxes that would have otherwise been payable under section 39, 41 or 42.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Tangible Personal Property Brought into British Columbia

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definition
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division, calculation year, in relation to tangible personal property, means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the period beginning on the date the property is first brought or sent into, or is delivered in, British Columbia during any year and ending on the day before the first anniversary of that date;

if the property is in British Columbia for a continuous period that is longer than the period referred to in paragraph (a), the period beginning on the day after the immediately preceding calculation year and ending on the day before the first anniversary of that date.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of this Division
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Division does not apply in relation to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tangible personal property that is subject to tax or is exempt from tax under section 37, 99 (3) or (4) or 101 (2);
tangible personal property, if tax is paid under Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] in respect of the tangible personal property;
a taxable conveyance, as defined in section 59, that is subject to tax or is exempt from tax under Division 6 [Conveyances Used Interjurisdictionally];

subject to section 49 (9.1), a multijurisdictional vehicle or a vehicle that is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a) [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed].

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), this section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, tangible personal property, other than tangible personal property that is received as a gift by that person, that is for use or consumption

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident,
by another person at the BC resident's expense,
by a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent, or
by another person at the expense of a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident who brings or sends into British Columbia tangible personal property that the person received as a gift and that is for use or consumption

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident,
by another person at the BC resident's expense,
by a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent, or
by another person at the expense of a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident and a person who is not a BC resident brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, tangible personal property that is for use or consumption

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident, or
by the person who is not a BC resident, or by another person, at the BC resident's expense, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property, and
uses the tangible personal property in British Columbia in the course of the person's business, whether or not the business is carried on in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any person referred to in subsection (1) has leased the tangible personal property, as lessee,
the director is satisfied under section 51 (1) that the tangible personal property is brought or sent into British Columbia, or is delivered in British Columbia, for temporary use, or
the person must pay tax imposed under section 51.1 in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply in relation to tangible personal property that is subject to tax under section 52.

A person is not required to pay tax under this section in respect of a vehicle if a person pays tax under section 50 in respect of the bringing or sending into British Columbia, or the delivery in British Columbia, of the vehicle.
A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under subsection (6).
The rate of tax payable under subsection (5) is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraphs (b) and (c), the applicable rate under section 34 [rates of tax in relation to purchase price],
subject to paragraph (c), the applicable rate under subsection (7.1) or (8) of this section if subsection (7.1) or (8) applies to the tangible personal property, and

if the tangible personal property that is subject to tax under subsection (5) is brought or sent into British Columbia by a person who received the tangible personal property as a gift, the applicable rate under section 36 [rates of tax in relation to gifts].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (7.2), subsection (7.1) or (8) applies in relation to a motor vehicle if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person to whom this section applies purchased the motor vehicle outside British Columbia but in Canada,
that person brought or sent into British Columbia, or received delivery of in British Columbia, that motor vehicle, and
at the time of sale of the motor vehicle to that person, another motor vehicle is accepted by the seller as consideration on account of the price of the motor vehicle sold.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (7.2) and (8), the rate of tax payable under subsection (5) on a motor vehicle to which this subsection applies is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the motor vehicle is not a passenger vehicle, at the rate of 12% of the purchase price of the motor vehicle;
if the motor vehicle is a passenger vehicle, at the applicable rate as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 12% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is more than $150 000.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the requirements in subsection (7), subsection (8) applies in relation to a motor vehicle if the person who must pay tax under subsection (5) on the motor vehicle, or another person referred to in subsection (1) (b),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: acquired the motor vehicle at a sale in Canada that is a taxable supply by a registrant under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, or
acquired the motor vehicle in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under subsection (5) on a motor vehicle to which this subsection applies is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the motor vehicle is not a passenger vehicle, at the rate of 7% of the purchase price of the motor vehicle;
if the motor vehicle is a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, at the applicable rate as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 7% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is less than $55 000;
8% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the passenger vehicle, if the original purchase price of the passenger vehicle is $150 000 or more;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the motor vehicle is a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, at the applicable rate as follows:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 7% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is less than $75 000;
8% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the purchase price of the zero-emission vehicle, if the original purchase price of the vehicle is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The amount of tax payable under subsection (5) by a person in relation to tangible personal property brought or sent into British Columbia is reduced by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax under this Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act that the person previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under those Acts, and

the amount of tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, that the person previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector, other than as lessor of a vehicle, causes the vehicle to be delivered in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the vehicle is to be immediately licensed in British Columbia as described in section 69 (1) (a), the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (5) of this section and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (5) of this section unless the collector obtains from that person, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the account number assigned by the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia to the person who licenses the vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector causes tangible personal property to be delivered in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under section 79 (2) or 80.5 (6) from paying tax under subsection (5) of this section, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (5) and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (5) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector causes tangible personal property to be delivered in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the tangible personal property is being purchased for resale, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (5) as if the person were a person to whom this section applies and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (5) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector causes tangible personal property to be delivered in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under section 80.1 (2) or 80.5 (7) from paying tax under subsection (5) of this section, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (5) and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (5) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number or, from that person, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director, and
a declaration in a form acceptable to the director and made by the party referred to in section 80.1 (2) (c) or 80.5 (7).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on registration of vehicle brought into British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, travel trailer means a vehicle designed to be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pulled on a highway, and
used as temporary or seasonal accommodation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person brought or sent into British Columbia, or received delivery of in British Columbia, a vehicle for use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the person,
by another person at the first person's expense,
by a principal for whom the first person acts as agent, or
by another person at the expense of a principal for whom the first person acts as agent, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any of the persons referred to in paragraph (a) register the vehicle under the vehicle registration legislation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), if this section applies, the person who registers the vehicle must pay to the government tax on the vehicle,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraph (b), at the applicable rate under section 34, and

if the tangible personal property that is subject to tax under this section is brought or sent into British Columbia by, or is delivered in British Columbia to, a person who received the tangible personal property as a gift, at the applicable rate under section 36 [rates of tax in relation to gifts].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person is not required to pay tax under this section in respect of a vehicle if the person has paid tax under section 49, 51.1 or 52 in respect of the vehicle.
A non-resident is exempt from tax imposed under subsection (2) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non-resident is an individual,
the tangible personal property is a travel trailer, and
the travel trailer is to be used in British Columbia solely for a non-business purpose.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for temporary use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 49 would apply to the person in relation to the tangible personal property if that section were read without reference to subsection (2) (b) of that section, and
the person establishes to the satisfaction of the director that the property is brought or sent into British Columbia, or is delivered in British Columbia, for temporary use.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply in respect of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tangible personal property that is brought or sent into, or delivered in, British Columbia for use as a part of any other tangible personal property;
tangible personal property that is brought or sent into British Columbia by, or is delivered in British Columbia to, a person who received the tangible personal property as a gift;
a vehicle that is registered for use in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (6), a person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax calculated in accordance with subsection (4) or (9).

Subject to subsection (9), the tax payable under subsection (3) is equal to 1/3 of the tax that would, but for this section, be payable under section 49 by the person in relation to the tangible personal property.

Except in relation to tangible personal property to which subsection (9) applies, tax must be calculated under subsection (4) separately for each calculation year during any part of which the tangible personal property is in British Columbia.

A person is not liable to pay to the government, in relation to the tangible personal property, a total amount of tax under subsection (3) that is in excess of an amount equal to the amount determined in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the applicable rate under section 34 [rates of tax in relation to purchase price];

(a) the tax the person has paid on the property under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under those Acts;
(b) the sales tax the person has paid on the property to another province and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate;

(c) the tax the person has paid on the property under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Except in relation to tangible personal property to which subsection (9) applies, tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the property is first used in British Columbia during the calculation year in respect of which tax is payable.
Subsection (9) applies to tangible personal property referred to in subsection (1) that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for use in petroleum or natural gas exploration or development, and
one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a cement truck;
a fracturing truck;
a vehicle on which seismic recording equipment or well logging equipment is permanently mounted.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (3) in relation to tangible personal property to which this subsection applies must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: calculated in accordance with the regulations,
calculated under paragraph (a) separately for each prescribed period during any part of which the tangible personal property is in British Columbia, and
paid on or before the prescribed date.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsections (7) and (9) (c), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if tangible personal property no longer for temporary use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 51 applied to the person in relation to the tangible personal property, and

within 3 years after the date on which the tangible personal property is first used in British Columbia and during a calculation year in respect of which tax was payable under section 51, the person uses that property, or allows that property to be used, in British Columbia for a purpose other than for temporary use.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax in an amount equal to the amount of tax under section 49 that would have otherwise been payable if that section had applied to the person in relation to the tangible personal property less the amount of tax paid by the person under section 51 in respect of the tangible personal property.

If this section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property that is prescribed for the purposes of section 25 (1), the purchase price to be used for the purposes of subsection (2) in determining the amount of tax under section 49 that would have otherwise been payable in relation to the tangible personal property is to be determined in accordance with section 25 (2) (a) (ii).

Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person uses that property, or allows that property to be used, for a purpose other than for temporary use.
Despite subsection (4), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia by non-residents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, travel trailer means a vehicle designed to be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: pulled on a highway, and
used as temporary or seasonal accommodation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), this section applies to a non-resident who brings or sends into British Columbia, or who receives delivery of in British Columbia, tangible personal property, if the tangible personal property is, for the year following its entry into British Columbia, to be used or consumed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: primarily in British Columbia, and
primarily by one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the non-resident;
a person for whom the non-resident acts as agent;
a person whose use or consumption of the tangible personal property is at the expense of the non-resident;
a person whose use or consumption of the tangible personal property is at the expense of a principal for whom the non-resident acts as agent.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a non-resident referred to in subsection (1) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non-resident has leased, as lessee, the tangible personal property, or
the non-resident must pay tax under section 50 in respect of the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A non-resident to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under section 34.
The amount of tax payable under subsection (4) by a non-resident in relation to tangible personal property brought or sent into British Columbia is reduced by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax under this Act, the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act or the Social Service Tax Act that the non-resident previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the non-resident has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under those Acts, and

the amount of tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, that the non-resident previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the non-resident has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A non-resident is exempt from tax imposed under subsection (4) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the non-resident is an individual,
the tangible personal property is a boat or travel trailer, and
the boat or travel trailer is to be used in British Columbia solely for a non-business purpose.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption if less than minimum threshold use in British Columbia
bcl:section.bcl:text: Tangible personal property is exempt from tax imposed under section 49 or 51 if the tangible personal property is in British Columbia during a calculation year for fewer than a prescribed number of days.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of this Division

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This Division applies if an agreement entered into under section 191 is in force between the government and the government of Canada or an agent of the government of Canada.
This Division does not apply in relation to the following tangible personal property:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tangible personal property that is subject to tax or is exempt from tax under section 63 [tax if conveyance brought into and used in British Columbia] or Division 7 [Multijurisdictional Vehicles];
goods that are for commercial use;
motor vehicles and trailers that are required to be registered under the Motor Vehicle Act;
off-road vehicles that are required to be registered under the Off-Road Vehicle Act;

tangible personal property that is not subject to tax under Division III of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act because the tangible personal property is a good included in section 1 or 7 of Schedule VII of that Act;
prescribed tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if property brought into British Columbia from outside Canada

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, taxable value, in relation to tangible personal property, means the value of the tangible personal property as determined under section 215 of the Excise Tax Act.

Unless subsection (2) applies, a resident taxpayer who brings tangible personal property into British Columbia from a place outside Canada, or who sends tangible personal property, or enters into an arrangement under which tangible personal property is sent, into British Columbia from a place outside Canada, must, at the time the tangible personal property enters British Columbia,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: report the matter to a customs officer,
supply to the customs officer all information required by the customs officer in respect of the tangible personal property, and
pay to the government, by paying to the customs officer as agent of the government, tax at the applicable rate under subsections (3) to (3.4), (3.6) and (3.7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (4), a resident taxpayer must, at the time of receiving, through a postal agent, tangible personal property in British Columbia from a place outside Canada,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: supply to the postal agent all information required by the postal agent in respect of the tangible personal property, and
pay to the government, by paying to the postal agent as agent of the government, tax at the applicable rate under subsections (3) to (3.4), (3.6) and (3.7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (3.1) to (3.4), (3.6) and (3.7), the rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) is 7% of the taxable value of the tangible personal property.
The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on liquor is 10% of the taxable value of the liquor.
The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on a manufactured mobile home is 7% of the amount equal to 50% of the taxable value of the manufactured mobile home.
The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on a manufactured modular home is 7% of the amount equal to 55% of the taxable value of the manufactured modular home.
The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on a portable building is 7% of the amount equal to 45% of the taxable value of the portable building.
Subsections (3.2) to (3.4) do not apply to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: free-standing appliances, free-standing furniture and draperies sold with a manufactured building;
repair parts purchased for a manufactured building.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on a vapour product is 20% of the taxable value of the vapour product.
The rate of tax payable under subsections (1) and (2) on a fossil fuel combustion system is 12% of the taxable value of the fossil fuel combustion system.

Subsection (2) does not apply unless there is an agreement in force between the Canada Post Corporation and the government of Canada or an agent of the government of Canada providing for the collection of tax under this Division by that corporation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Detention of tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a resident taxpayer fails or refuses to comply with section 55, a collection agent may detain the tangible personal property.
Tangible personal property detained under subsection (1) must be dealt with as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if, within 60 days after the date of the detention, the tax that was payable in respect of the tangible personal property at the time of its detention and any expenses related to the detention are paid and the requirements of section 55 (1) (b) or (2) (a) are met, the tangible personal property must be returned to the resident taxpayer;

if the tax and the expenses relating to the detention are not paid within the period referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection or the requirements of section 55 (1) (b) or (2) (a) are not met within that period, the tangible personal property is forfeited to the government and may be disposed of as directed by the director.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax payable to collection agent even though exemption claimed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a resident taxpayer alleges that tangible personal property is exempt under Part 6 [Exemptions] or under the regulations from tax imposed under this Division, the collection agent, in the circumstances specified in the agreement entered into under section 191, may nevertheless require that the resident taxpayer pay the tax.
If the collection agent requires payment of the tax under subsection (1), the resident taxpayer

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must pay the tax to the collection agent, and
may apply to the government of Canada or an agent of the government of Canada for a refund under section 191 (6) (b) of the tax paid in respect of that tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund if property brought into British Columbia for temporary use
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a resident taxpayer paid tax under section 55 in relation to tangible personal property, and

but for section 48 (b) [application of Division 4], the resident taxpayer would have paid tax under section 51 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for temporary use] in relation to the tangible personal property,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the resident taxpayer the amount of tax paid under section 55 less the amount of tax that would have otherwise been payable under section 51.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: aircraft part means a part of an interjurisdictional aircraft;
conveyance part means a part of an interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or a part of an interjurisdictional conveyance;
eligible flights, in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, means flights originating or terminating in British Columbia or connecting 2 or more points in British Columbia;
interjurisdictional aircraft means an aircraft used

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: interprovincially or internationally for commercial purposes, and
in eligible flights;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: interjurisdictional conveyance means a vessel or any other conveyance, other than an interjurisdictional aircraft or interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, used in interprovincial or international trade for the commercial carriage of passengers or goods;
interjurisdictional railway rolling stock means railway rolling stock used interprovincially or internationally;
taxable conveyance means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an interjurisdictional aircraft;
an aircraft part;
interjurisdictional railway rolling stock;
an interjurisdictional conveyance;
a conveyance part.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if conveyance purchased in British Columbia for interjurisdictional use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchases at a sale in British Columbia a conveyance and, from the date of purchase,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aircraft, uses the aircraft as an interjurisdictional aircraft,
in the case of railway rolling stock, uses the railway rolling stock as interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, and
in the case of a vessel or any other conveyance, other than an aircraft or railway rolling stock, uses the conveyance as an interjurisdictional conveyance, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchases at a sale in British Columbia a part for a conveyance and, from the date of purchase, the part is to be installed in an interjurisdictional aircraft, interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the taxable conveyance in the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the purchase price of the taxable conveyance;
whichever of the following is applicable:

in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the number of hours the aircraft will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during the period beginning on the date of purchase of the aircraft and ending on the third anniversary of that date;
in relation to an aircraft part, the number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during,
(i) in the case of a prescribed part, the period beginning on the date of purchase of the prescribed part and ending on the third anniversary of that date, and
(ii) in any other case, the year after the date of purchase of the part;

in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the distance the conveyance will travel, during the year after its date of purchase, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;

in relation to a conveyance part, the distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel, during the year after the date of purchase of the part, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;
whichever of the following is applicable:
in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the total number of hours the aircraft will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (a) of the description of "BC usage";

in relation to an aircraft part, the total number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (b) of the description of "BC usage";
in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the total distance the conveyance will travel during the year after its date of purchase;
in relation to a conveyance part, the total distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel during the year after the date of purchase of the part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person purchased the conveyance or the part for a conveyance.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if sale and lease-back of conveyance

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: BC usage means BC usage within the meaning of section 60, 63 or 64, as applicable;

lease ratio, in relation to a conveyance for a rental period, means the ratio of the distance of travel by the conveyance in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia during the rental period to the total distance of travel by the conveyance during that period;
purchase ratio, in relation to a conveyance, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraph (b), the ratio of the BC usage to the total usage that was used to determine the tax payable under section 60, 63 or 64 by a lessee, or
the ratio of the BC usage to the total usage as determined in accordance with section 66 (1) (c) by the lessee;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: total usage means total usage within the meaning of section 60, 63 or 64, as applicable.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a lessee of a conveyance if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lessee became lessee by selling the conveyance to the lessor under a sale and immediate lease-back arrangement,
the lessee had, before the sale to the lessor, paid

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: as purchaser of the conveyance the tax applicable under section 60, or
the tax applicable under section 63 or 64 in relation to the conveyance, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the conveyance is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, or
an interjurisdictional conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A lessee to whom this section applies must pay to the government, in respect of a rental period under the lease, tax calculated in accordance with subsection (3), if the lease ratio for the conveyance for the rental period exceeds the purchase ratio for the conveyance.
Tax payable under subsection (2) must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax = 7% × lease price × (lease ratio − purchase ratio)
the lease price of the conveyance attributable to the rental period;
the lease ratio for the conveyance for the rental period;
the purchase ratio for the conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "lease ratio" in subsection (0.1), the distances of travel during a rental period are whichever of the following is applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the lease price for a rental period is payable at the end of or after the end of the rental period, the actual distances travelled;
in any other case, an estimate made in accordance with section 65 of the distances to be travelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the rental period ends.
Despite subsection (5), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if sale and lease-back of conveyance for which tax paid under former Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: initial ratio, in relation to a conveyance, means the ratio of the distance of travel by the conveyance in British Columbia, or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia during the first year

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: after the date of purchase by the person who became the lessee of the conveyance if the conveyance is purchased in British Columbia, or
after the entry date for the conveyance if the conveyance is not purchased in British Columbia

bcl:definition.bcl:text: to the total distance of travel by the conveyance during that first year;

lease ratio, in relation to a conveyance for a rental period, means the ratio of the distance of travel by the conveyance in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia during the rental period to the total distance of travel by the conveyance during that period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), this section applies to a lessee of a conveyance if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the lessee became lessee by selling the conveyance to the lessor under a sale and immediate lease-back arrangement,

the lessee had, before the sale to the lessor, paid tax imposed under section 13 [calculation of tax if property is conveyance used interjurisdictionally] or 15 [tax if conveyance purchased in B.C. for interjurisdictional use] of the Social Service Tax Act in respect of the conveyance and for which the lessee has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act, and
the conveyance is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, or
an interjurisdictional conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a lessee of a conveyance if section 61 applies to the lessee in respect of the conveyance.

A lessee to whom this section applies must pay to the government, in respect of a rental period under the lease, tax calculated in accordance with subsection (5), if the lease ratio for the conveyance for the rental period exceeds the initial ratio for the conveyance.
Tax payable under subsection (4) must be calculated in accordance with the following formula

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax = 7% × lease price × (lease ratio − initial ratio)
the lease price of the conveyance attributable to the rental period;
the lease ratio for the conveyance for the rental period;
the initial ratio for the conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "lease ratio" in subsection (1), the distances of travel during a rental period are whichever of the following is applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the lease price for a rental period is payable at the end of or after the end of the rental period, the actual distances travelled;
in any other case, an estimate made in accordance with section 65 of the distances to be travelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (4) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the rental period ends.
Despite subsection (7), tax payable under subsection (4) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if leased conveyance used in British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lessee who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: leases, in or outside British Columbia, an aircraft, and
uses, during a rental period under the lease, the aircraft as an interjurisdictional aircraft;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lessee who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: leases, in or outside British Columbia, any railway rolling stock, and
uses, during a rental period under the lease, the railway rolling stock as interjurisdictional railway rolling stock;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a lessee who

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: leases, in or outside British Columbia, a vessel or other conveyance, other than railway rolling stock or an aircraft, and
uses, during a rental period under the lease, the vessel or other conveyance as an interjurisdictional conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a lessee of a conveyance if section 61 or 61.1 applies to the lessee in respect of the conveyance.
A lessee to whom this section applies must pay to the government, in respect of the rental period referred to in subsection (1), tax calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the lease price of the conveyance attributable to the rental period;
whichever of the following is applicable:
in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the number of hours the aircraft will fly during the rental period in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights;

in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the distance the conveyance will travel, during the rental period, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;
whichever of the following is applicable:
in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the total number of hours the aircraft will fly during that rental period;
in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the total distance the conveyance will travel during that rental period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of calculations under subsection (3), the distances of travel during a rental period are whichever of the following is applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the lease price for a rental period is payable at the end of or after the end of the rental period, the actual distances travelled;
in any other case, an estimate made in accordance with section 65 of the distances to be travelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the rental period ends.
Despite subsection (5), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.
A conveyance is exempt from tax imposed under this section if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the conveyance was sold to the lessor by the lessee under a sale and immediate lease-back arrangement, and
the lessee had, before the sale to the lessor,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax imposed under section 19 [tax on designated property acquired in British Columbia] or 20 [tax on designated property brought into British Columbia] of the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act in respect of the conveyance and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act, or

in respect of the conveyance, paid tax imposed under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if conveyance brought into and used in British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a person in relation to a taxable conveyance if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the taxable conveyance and the conveyance is for use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident,
by another person at the BC resident's expense,
by a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent, or
by another person at the expense of a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident and a person who is not a BC resident brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the taxable conveyance and the conveyance is for use

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident, or
by the person who is not a BC resident, or by another person, at the BC resident's expense, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the taxable conveyance, and
