uses the conveyance in British Columbia in the course of the person's business, whether or not the business is carried on in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person if any person referred to in subsection (1) has leased the taxable conveyance, as lessee.
A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the taxable conveyance in the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the purchase price of the taxable conveyance;
whichever of the following is applicable:

in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the number of hours the aircraft will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during the period beginning on the entry date of the aircraft and ending on the third anniversary of that date;
in relation to an aircraft part, the number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during,
in the case of a prescribed part, the period beginning on the entry date of the prescribed part and ending on the third anniversary of that date, and
in any other case, the year after the entry date of the part;

in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the distance the conveyance will travel, during the year after its entry date, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;

in relation to a conveyance part, the distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel, during the year after the entry date of the part, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;
whichever of the following is applicable:
in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the total number of hours the aircraft will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (a) of the description of "BC usage";

in relation to an aircraft part, the total number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (b) of the description of "BC usage";
in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the total distance the conveyance will travel during the year after its entry date;
in relation to a conveyance part, the total distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel during the year after the entry date of the part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month that includes the entry date of the taxable conveyance.
Despite subsection (4), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of conveyance acquired for resale

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia a conveyance for resale, becomes, for any period, a user of the conveyance and, from the date on which the person becomes the user,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aircraft, uses the aircraft as an interjurisdictional aircraft,
in the case of railway rolling stock, uses the railway rolling stock as interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, and
in the case of a vessel or any other conveyance, other than an aircraft or railway rolling stock, uses the vessel or other conveyance as an interjurisdictional conveyance, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia a part for a conveyance for resale, becomes, for any period, a user of a conveyance in which the part is installed and, from the date on which the person becomes the user,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of an aircraft, uses the aircraft as an interjurisdictional aircraft,
in the case of railway rolling stock, uses the railway rolling stock as interjurisdictional railway rolling stock, and
in the case of a vessel or any other conveyance, other than an aircraft or railway rolling stock, uses the vessel or other conveyance as an interjurisdictional conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the taxable conveyance in the amount determined by the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: the purchase price of the taxable conveyance;
whichever of the following is applicable:

in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the number of hours the aircraft will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during the period beginning on the date the person becomes the user of the aircraft and ending on the third anniversary of that date;
in relation to an aircraft part, the number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly in the airspace over British Columbia in eligible flights during,
in the case of a prescribed part, the period beginning on the date the person becomes the user of the prescribed part and ending on the third anniversary of that date, and
in any other case, the year after the date the person becomes the user of the part;

in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the distance the conveyance will travel, during the year after the date the person becomes the user of the conveyance, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;

in relation to a conveyance part, the distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel, during the year after the date the person becomes the user of the conveyance, in British Columbia or, if the conveyance is a vessel, in the waters of British Columbia;
whichever of the following is applicable:
in relation to an interjurisdictional aircraft, the total number of hours the aircraft will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (a) of the description of "BC usage";

in relation to an aircraft part, the total number of hours the aircraft in which the part is or is to be installed will fly during the period referred to in paragraph (b) of the description of "BC usage";

in relation to interjurisdictional railway rolling stock or an interjurisdictional conveyance, the total distance the conveyance will travel during the year after the date the person becomes the user of the conveyance;

in relation to a conveyance part, the total distance the conveyance in which the part is or is to be installed will travel during the year after the date the person becomes the user of the conveyance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first becomes a user of the taxable conveyance.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Estimate of hours or distance conveyance will travel

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, relevant provision means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the definition of "lease ratio" in section 61 (0.1);
the definitions of "initial ratio" and "lease ratio" in section 61.1 (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of the relevant provisions, the following must be based on a reasonable estimate:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the number of hours or the distance a conveyance will travel during the relevant period in the airspace over, in the waters of or in British Columbia;
the total number of hours or the total distance the conveyance will travel during the period referred to in paragraph (a).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustment of tax

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, for the purposes of a relevant provision as defined in section 65 (1), an estimate is made under section 65 for a relevant period in relation to a conveyance, at the end of the period the person to whom section 60 (2), 61 (2), 61.1 (4), 62 (3), 63 (3) or 64 (2) applies must determine the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the actual number of hours or the actual distance the conveyance travelled during the relevant period in the airspace over, in the waters of or in British Columbia;
the total actual number of hours or the total actual distance the conveyance travelled during that relevant period;

the amount determined by the formula in section 60 (2), 61 (3), 61.1 (5), 62 (3), 63 (3) or 64 (2), using the hours and distance determined under paragraphs (a) and (b) of this subsection instead of the estimated hours and distance.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), if a conveyance is sold within a relevant period, the relevant period in relation to the conveyance is deemed to end at the time of sale.

If the amount determined under subsection (1) (c) for a relevant period exceeds the amount determined under the applicable section for the relevant period based on the reasonable estimate under section 65, the person to whom the applicable section applies must pay to the government tax equal to the amount of the excess.
Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the relevant period ends.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

If the director is satisfied that the amount determined under the applicable section for a relevant period based on the reasonable estimate under section 65 exceeds the amount determined under subsection (1) (c) of this section for the relevant period, the director must refund to the person to whom the applicable section applies the amount of the excess.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund for conveyances used interjurisdictionally
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person has paid tax under section 37 [tax on purchase], 39 [tax on leases] or 49 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use] in respect of a conveyance or a part for a conveyance, and
the person ought to have paid tax under section 60, 62 or 63, as applicable, in respect of the conveyance or part instead of paying tax under section 37, 39 or 49,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to that person the difference between the tax paid by the person on the conveyance or part and the tax that ought to have been paid in accordance with this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: acquisition date means,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a purchased vehicle, the date on which the vehicle is purchased,
in the case of a leased vehicle, the date on which the lessee first becomes entitled, under the lease, to have access to the vehicle, or
in the case of a vehicle that is a gift, the date the recipient of the gift receives possession of the vehicle;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: acquisition year means,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a purchased vehicle, the calendar year in which the vehicle is purchased,
in the case of a leased vehicle, the calendar year in which the lessee first becomes entitled, under the lease, to have access to the vehicle, or
in the case of a vehicle that is a gift, the calendar year in which the recipient of the gift receives possession of the vehicle;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: bus has the same meaning as in the Motor Vehicle Act;

fleet licence year, in respect of vehicles licensed as part of a fleet to which a prorating agreement applies, means the period beginning on a fleet licensing date for the fleet vehicles and ending on the day before the anniversary of that fleet licensing date;
prorating agreement means an agreement made under section 10 (1) of the Commercial Transport Act;
travel ratio, in respect of a vehicle, means the travel ratio determined in accordance with the regulations;
vehicle does not include a trailer;
vehicle taxable value means, in respect of a vehicle

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that is purchased for fair market value, the purchase price of the vehicle,
that is a leased vehicle, the greater of the purchase price of the vehicle, as described in the lease, and the fair market value of the vehicle on the vehicle's acquisition date, or
that is acquired for less than fair market value, the fair market value of the vehicle on the vehicle's acquisition date,

bcl:definition.bcl:text: and includes any capital expenditure made to the vehicle within 30 days after the vehicle's acquisition date.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following persons must pay to the government tax, in accordance with this Division, for a vehicle licence period:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person who licenses a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies;
a person who licenses a vehicle outside British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and, in the vehicle licence period, brings or sends that vehicle into British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (1) in respect of a vehicle for a vehicle licence period must be calculated in accordance with the following formula:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: tax = taxable value × rate × travel ratio × travel months
established under subsection (3), if the vehicle is not a bus, or
established under subsection (3.1), if the vehicle is a bus;
the travel ratio for the vehicle;
the number of whole and partial months in the vehicle licence period at the time that the vehicle is licensed, divided by 12.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In each calendar year in which tax is payable under subsection (1), the tax rate in respect of a vehicle, other than a bus, is the rate shown opposite the applicable calendar year as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: 1st calendar year after the acquisition year
2nd calendar year after the acquisition year
3rd calendar year after the acquisition year
4th calendar year after the acquisition year
5th calendar year after the acquisition year
6th calendar year after the acquisition year
7th calendar year after the acquisition year
8th calendar year after the acquisition year
9th and subsequent calendar years after the acquisition year

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In each calendar year in which tax is payable under subsection (1), the tax rate in respect of a bus is the rate shown opposite the applicable calendar year as follows:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: 1st calendar year after the acquisition year
2nd calendar year after the acquisition year
3rd calendar year after the acquisition year
4th calendar year after the acquisition year
5th calendar year after the acquisition year
6th calendar year after the acquisition year
7th calendar year after the acquisition year
8th calendar year after the acquisition year
9th and subsequent calendar years after the acquisition year

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: [Repealed 2015-9-48.]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: When tax under section 69 must be paid

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under section 69 (1) for a vehicle licence period in respect of a vehicle must be paid as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the vehicle is licensed in British Columbia, the tax must be paid to the government, by paying the tax to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia, at the time that the vehicle is licensed for that vehicle licence period;

in any other case, unless paid earlier under subsection (2), the tax must be paid to the government on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the vehicle first enters British Columbia in that vehicle licence period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the vehicle in respect of which tax is payable under this Division is licensed in a prescribed jurisdiction outside British Columbia, the tax may be paid, by paying the tax to the prescribed jurisdiction, at the time that the vehicle is licensed in that jurisdiction for that vehicle licence period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Adjustment of tax under section 69

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person is required to pay tax imposed under section 69 in respect of a vehicle for a vehicle licence period and the tax payable under that section is calculated using a travel ratio for the vehicle determined under section 69 (4) (a) as it read immediately before its repeal, the person must determine the following at the end of the vehicle licence period:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the actual distance the vehicles in the fleet of vehicles referred to in section 69 (4) (a) as it read immediately before its repeal travelled in British Columbia during the fleet licence year;
the actual total distance that the vehicles in the fleet travelled during that fleet licence year;

the amount calculated by the formula in section 69 (2), using the distances determined under paragraphs (a) and (b) of this subsection instead of the estimated distance under section 69 (4) (a) as it read immediately before its repeal.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the amount determined under subsection (1) (c) for a vehicle licence period exceeds the amount determined under section 69 (2) for the vehicle licence period based on the reasonable estimates under section 69 (4) (a) as it read immediately before its repeal, the person who is required to pay tax imposed under section 69 in respect of a vehicle for a vehicle licence period must pay to the government tax equal to the amount of the excess.
Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the vehicle licence period ends.

If the director is satisfied that the amount determined under section 69 (2) for the vehicle licence period based on the reasonable estimates under section 69 (4) (a) as it read immediately before its repeal exceeds the amount determined under subsection (1) (c) of this section for the vehicle licence period, the director must refund to the person who paid tax under section 69 the amount of the excess.
This section does not apply in relation to tax imposed under section 69 on or after January 1, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if vehicle ceases to be multijurisdictional

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a person in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person licensed the vehicle under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies,
the person paid tax under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle, and
the vehicle ceases to be licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and is subsequently licensed for use solely within British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person, as lessee, leases the vehicle,
the person previously licensed the vehicle for use solely within British Columbia before licensing the vehicle under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, or
the vehicle was transferred to the person under an agreement that provided that a beneficial interest in the vehicle was retained by the person who transferred the vehicle.
[Repealed 2014-4-63.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the purchase price of the vehicle.

Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid to the government by paying the tax to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia at the time the vehicle is licensed for use solely within British Columbia.

If a person must pay tax under subsection (3), the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide to the person a credit in relation to the tax paid by that person under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle.
The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against the tax payable under subsection (3) by the person in respect of the vehicle, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if transferred vehicle ceases to be multijurisdictional

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person transferred the vehicle under an agreement but retained a beneficial interest in the vehicle,

the vehicle was licensed by the person to whom the vehicle was transferred under subparagraph (i) under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and that person paid tax under one or both of sections 69 and 71,
the vehicle ceases to be licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and is subsequently licensed for use solely within British Columbia, and
the person referred to in subparagraph (ii) has ceased to hold an interest in the vehicle, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the person received an interest in the vehicle under an agreement referred to in paragraph (a) (i),
the vehicle was licensed by the person under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and that person paid tax under one or both of sections 69 and 71,
the vehicle ceases to be licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies and is subsequently licensed for use solely within British Columbia, and
the person continues to hold an interest in the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any person referred to in subsection (1), as lessee, leases the vehicle, or
the vehicle was licensed for use solely within British Columbia

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: before the vehicle was licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, and
during the period in which the person referred to in subsection (1) (a) (i) retained a beneficial interest in the vehicle.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Repealed 2014-4-64.]

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the purchase price of the vehicle.

Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid to the government by paying the tax to the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia at the time the vehicle is licensed for use solely within British Columbia.

If a person must pay tax under subsection (3), the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide to the person a credit in relation to the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle.
The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (5)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against the tax payable under subsection (3) by the person in respect of the vehicle, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Liability of other persons
bcl:section.bcl:text: If tax is payable by a person under this Division in respect of a vehicle for a vehicle licence period, any other person who had management of or the right to determine the utilization of the vehicle while it was in British Columbia during the vehicle licence period is jointly and severally liable with any other person liable for that tax.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit of tax if fleet licensing changed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, licensed means licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies.
If a vehicle that is licensed by a person as part of a fleet is, before the end of the fleet licence year applicable to that fleet, licensed by the person as part of a different fleet,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person must pay to the government tax imposed under section 69 (1) in respect of the vehicle's vehicle licence period when licensed as part of the different fleet, and

that person is entitled to a credit under subsection (2) or refund under subsection (3) in relation to the tax paid by that person under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle for the last vehicle licence period under the previous licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1.2) applies in relation to a vehicle if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person transferred the vehicle under an agreement but retained a beneficial interest in the vehicle,
the vehicle was licensed by another person as part of a fleet,

the vehicle is, before the end of the fleet licence year applicable to that fleet, licensed by the person referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection or by a third person as part of a different fleet, and
the person referred to in paragraph (a) retains a beneficial interest in the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If this subsection applies in relation to a vehicle, the person who licensed the vehicle as part of the different fleet referred to in subsection (1.1) (c)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must pay to the government tax imposed under section 69 (1) in respect of the vehicle's vehicle licence period when licensed as part of the different fleet, and

is entitled to a credit under subsection (2) or refund under subsection (3) in relation to the tax paid under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle for the last vehicle licence period under the previous licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the vehicle that is licensed as part of a different fleet is licensed in British Columbia, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide to the person, at the time the vehicle is licensed as part of the different fleet, a credit of a portion of the tax previously paid under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle for the last vehicle licence period under the previous licence against the amount of any tax that the person is required to pay under this Division.

If the vehicle that is licensed as part of a different fleet is not licensed in British Columbia, the director may pay to the person a refund of a portion of the tax previously paid under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle for the last vehicle licence period under the previous licence.
The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (2)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against any tax payable under this Division by the person in respect of the vehicle until the full amount of the credit has been applied in that manner, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (3) must be calculated in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund if vehicle ceases to be multijurisdictional

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director must pay to a person a refund of a portion of the tax paid by the person under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of a vehicle for the last vehicle licence period under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person licensed the vehicle under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies,
the person paid tax under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle,
before the end of that vehicle licence period, the vehicle ceases to be licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies,
no person is entitled to a credit or refund under section 74 in respect of the vehicle, and
either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: no tax is payable under section 72 or 72.1 in respect of the vehicle because of section 72 (2) (a) or (b) or 72.1 (2), or
on ceasing to be licensed under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, the vehicle is licensed for use within another jurisdiction and is not licensed for use within British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (1) must be calculated in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund at end of vehicle licence period

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director must pay to a person a refund of a portion of the tax paid by the person under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of a vehicle licensed, for a vehicle licence period, under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if, at the end of the vehicle licence period, the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person licensed the vehicle under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies,
the person paid tax under one or both of sections 69 and 71 in respect of the vehicle,
before the end of that vehicle licence period, the vehicle ceased to be licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies,
the vehicle was not licensed for use solely within British Columbia subsequent to being licensed under the licence to which the prorating agreement applies, and
no person is entitled to a credit or refund under section 74 in respect of the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (1) must be calculated in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Credit if tax previously paid

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide a credit to a person who licenses a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle is so licensed before the end of the 4th calendar year after the calendar year in which is its acquisition date, and
the person had previously paid tax on the purchase price of the vehicle under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 37 [tax on purchase],
section 49 (5) [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use], as that tax was calculated under section 49 (6), or
section 50 [tax on registration of vehicle brought into British Columbia].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide a credit to a person who licenses a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle is transferred to the person under an agreement but the transferor retains a beneficial interest in the vehicle,
the vehicle is so licensed before the end of the 4th calendar year after the calendar year in which is the transferor's acquisition date for the vehicle, and
the transferor referred to in paragraph (a) had previously paid tax on the purchase price of the vehicle under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 37 [tax on purchase],
section 49 (5) [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use], as that tax was calculated under section 49 (6), or
section 50 [tax on registration of vehicle brought into British Columbia].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (1) or (1.1)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against any tax payable under this Division by the person in respect of the vehicle until the full amount of the credit has been applied in that manner, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — credit if tax previously paid

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide a credit to a person who licenses a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle is so licensed before the end of the 4th calendar year after the calendar year in which is its acquisition date,
the person had previously

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 5 [tax on purchase] or 11 (3) [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use] of the Social Service Tax Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act,

paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 19 [tax on designated property acquired in British Columbia], 20 [tax on designated property brought into British Columbia] or 21 [tax on registration of vehicle brought into British Columbia] of the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act, or

paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, that the person previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle was purchased in British Columbia or was first brought, sent or delivered into British Columbia after March 31, 2009 but before April 1, 2013, and
the vehicle is subject to tax imposed under section 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed] of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide a credit to a person who licenses a vehicle in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle is transferred to the person under an agreement but the transferor retains a beneficial interest in the vehicle,
the vehicle is so licensed before the end of the 4th calendar year after the calendar year in which is the transferor's acquisition date for the vehicle,
the transferor referred to in paragraph (a) had previously

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 5 or 11 (3) of the Social Service Tax Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act,

paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 19, 20 or 21 of the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act, or

paid tax in relation to the vehicle under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, that the person previously paid in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the vehicle was purchased in British Columbia or was first brought, sent or delivered into British Columbia after March 31, 2009 but before April 1, 2013, and
the vehicle is subject to tax imposed under section 69 of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (1) or (2)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against any tax payable under this Division by the person in respect of the vehicle until the full amount of the credit has been applied in that manner, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund from Insurance Corporation of British Columbia authorized under regulations
bcl:section.bcl:text: If authorized by the regulations, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia may refund all or part of an amount paid as tax under this Division.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund or credit for trade-in vehicles

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: new vehicle means the vehicle referred to in the definition of "trade-in vehicle" in respect of which tax is payable under section 69 [tax if multijurisdictional vehicle licensed];

trade-in vehicle means a multijurisdictional vehicle on which tax has been paid under this Division and that, before the expiration of its current vehicle licence period, is accepted at the time of sale by the seller on account of the purchase price of another multijurisdictional vehicle in respect of which tax is payable under section 69.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the new vehicle is licensed in British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, the Insurance Corporation of British Columbia must provide to the person licensing the new vehicle, at the time the vehicle is licensed, a credit of a portion of the tax paid under this Division on the trade-in vehicle against the amount of tax the person is required to pay under this Division in respect of the new vehicle.

If the new vehicle is licensed outside British Columbia under a licence to which a prorating agreement applies, the director may provide to the person who licensed the new vehicle a refund of a portion of the tax paid on the trade-in vehicle.

Subject to subsection (5), the credit under subsection (2) and the refund under subsection (3) must be limited to the tax paid under this Division that is attributable to the portion of the current vehicle licence period of the trade-in vehicle remaining after the trade-in vehicle has been traded.
The credit to which a person is entitled under subsection (2)

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be calculated in accordance with the regulations,
must be applied against any tax payable under this Division by the person in respect of the vehicle until the full amount of the credit has been applied in that manner, and
must not be provided to the person in any other manner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under subsection (3) must be calculated in accordance with the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund for replacement vehicles

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, replacement vehicle means a vehicle that is leased to be used as a replacement for a multijurisdictional vehicle that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is being repaired, and
is therefore unavailable for use during part of its vehicle licence period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person has paid tax under this Division or under section 39 (1) on a replacement vehicle,
tax has been paid under this Division on the multijurisdictional vehicle being repaired, and
the replacement vehicle is used only

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in accordance with the terms of the licence that was issued for the multijurisdictional vehicle being repaired, and
for the purposes for which that multijurisdictional vehicle would be used were it not being repaired,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the tax referred to in paragraph (a).

Any refund under this section is, if the refund is in respect of tax paid under section 39 (1), limited to the tax paid on lease payments for the replacement vehicle in respect of rental periods, or portions of rental periods, that are wholly within

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the period during which the multijurisdictional vehicle is being repaired, and
the vehicle licence period of the multijurisdictional vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Any refund under this section is, if the refund is in respect of tax paid under this Division, limited to the tax paid that is attributable to the portion of the replacement vehicle's vehicle licence period that is wholly within

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the period during which the multijurisdictional vehicle is being repaired, and
the vehicle licence period of the multijurisdictional vehicle.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund for short term rental vehicles
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person paid tax under this Division in relation to a multijurisdictional vehicle that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a short term rental vehicle, and
is leased, during a vehicle licence period, primarily to other persons who must pay tax under section 39 [tax on leases] in relation to the lease, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tax was levied and remitted as required under this Act in respect of tax payable under section 39 on the lease of the short term rental vehicle during the vehicle licence period,

bcl:section.bcl:text: the director must refund to the person the tax paid under this Division for that vehicle licence period in relation to the multijurisdictional vehicle.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Affixed Machinery and Improvements to Real Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Contractor exempt from tax under section 37 or 49

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A contractor is exempt from tax imposed under section 37 [tax on purchase] in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property situated in British Columbia, purchases the tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and

there is evidence, in the form described in section 80.61, that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under section 80 in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A contractor is exempt from tax imposed under section 49 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use] in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property situated in British Columbia, brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and

there is evidence, in the form described in section 80.61, that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under section 80 in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on tangible personal property used to improve real property if contractor exempt

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has entered into the contract referred to in section 79 (1) (a) or (2) (a) with a contractor in relation to the tangible personal property, and

the contractor is exempt under section 79 from tax imposed under section 37 [tax on purchase] or 49 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use] in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.
If tax is paid under this section in respect of tangible personal property, then no tax is payable in respect of that property under section 37 or 49.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Contractor exempt from tax under section 37 or 49 if other person would be exempt

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), a contractor is exempt from tax imposed under section 37 [tax on purchase] in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a written contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property, purchases the tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and
the other party who entered into the contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;
a person who would be exempt under this Act from tax imposed under section 37 if the person were to purchase the tangible personal property;
a First Nation individual or band that would be exempt from tax imposed under section 37 if the First Nation individual or band were to purchase the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), a contractor is exempt from tax imposed under section 49 [tax if tangible personal property brought into British Columbia for use] in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a written contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property, brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and
the other party who entered into the contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;

a person who would be exempt under this Act from tax imposed under section 49 if the person were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property;

a First Nation individual or band that would be exempt from tax imposed under section 49 if the First Nation individual or band were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) (c) (i) or (2) (c) (i) does not apply if the government of Canada has entered into an agreement with the government of British Columbia under which the government of Canada has agreed to pay tax imposed under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund of tax paid by contractor under Division 5

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The director must refund to a contractor the tax paid under Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] by the contractor in relation to tangible personal property if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property situated in British Columbia,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brings the tangible personal property into British Columbia from a place outside Canada, or
sends the tangible personal property, or enters into an arrangement under which the tangible personal property is sent, into British Columbia from a place outside Canada,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor paid tax under Division 5 in relation to the tangible personal property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and

there is evidence, in the form described in section 80.61, that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under section 80.3 in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the director must refund to a contractor the tax paid under Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] by the contractor in relation to tangible personal property if the director is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a written contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brings the tangible personal property into British Columbia from a place outside Canada, or
sends the tangible personal property, or enters into an arrangement under which the tangible personal property is sent, into British Columbia from a place outside Canada,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor paid tax under Division 5 in relation to the tangible personal property,
under the terms of the contract, the tangible personal property will be used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and
the other party who entered into the contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;

a person who would be exempt under this Act from tax imposed under Division 5 if the person were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property;

a First Nation individual or band that would be exempt from tax imposed under Division 5 if the First Nation individual or band were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) (d) (i) does not apply if the government of Canada has entered into an agreement with the government of British Columbia under which the government of Canada has agreed to pay tax imposed under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on tangible personal property used to improve real property if contractor obtained refund

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has entered into a contract referred to in section 80.2 (1) (a) with a contractor in relation to the tangible personal property, and
the contractor has obtained a refund under section 80.2 in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.
Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of tangible personal property used to improve real property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has entered into a contract referred to in section 80.1 (1) (a) or (2) (a), 80.2 (2) (a) or 80.5 (1) (b) with a contractor in relation to the property,

the contractor was exempt under section 80.1 (1) (c) (ii) or (2) (c) (ii) or 80.5 (7) (b) or entitled to a refund under section 80.2 (2) (d) (ii) because the person would have been exempt from tax under this Act because the property was to be used for a particular purpose, and
the person subsequently uses that property, or allows that property to be used, for a purpose other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the particular purpose, or
another purpose for which the property would be exempt from tax under this Act if the property were to be used for that purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses that property, or allows that property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (c).
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional tax on tangible personal property used by contractor to improve real property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a contractor in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: purchased tangible personal property at a sale in British Columbia, or
brought or sent into British Columbia, or received delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contractor, for the purposes of fulfilling a contract under which the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property, uses the tangible personal property so that it ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A contractor to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.
The amount of tax payable under subsection (2) by a contractor in relation to tangible personal property is reduced by the total of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax under section 37, 49 or 55 payable or previously paid by the contractor in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the contractor has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under this Act;

the amount of tax under the Social Service Tax Act previously paid by the contractor in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the contractor has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act;

the amount of tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, previously paid by the contractor in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the contractor has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the contractor uses the tangible personal property in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law.
Despite subsection (4), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.
A contractor is exempt from tax imposed under subsection (2) in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: there is evidence, in the form described in section 80.61, that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under section 80.6 in relation to the tangible personal property, and

for the purpose of fulfilling the contract referred to in subsection (1) (b), the contractor is required to supply and affix, or install, affixed machinery or improvements to real property situated in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (8), a contractor is exempt from tax imposed under subsection (2) in relation to tangible personal property if the contract referred to in subsection (1) (b) is in writing and the other party who entered into that contract with the contractor is one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the government of Canada;
a person who would be exempt under this Act from tax

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: imposed under section 37 if the person were to purchase the tangible personal property, or
imposed under section 49 if the person were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a First Nation individual or band that would be exempt from tax

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: imposed under section 37 if the First Nation individual or band were to purchase the tangible personal property, or
imposed under section 49 if the First Nation individual or band were to bring or send into British Columbia, or receive delivery of in British Columbia, the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (7) (a) does not apply if the government of Canada has entered into an agreement with the government of British Columbia under which the government of Canada has agreed to pay tax imposed under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional tax on tangible personal property used to improve real property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has entered into a contract referred to in section 80.5 (1) (b) with a contractor,
the contractor uses the tangible personal property so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, and
the contractor is exempt under section 80.5 (6) from tax imposed under section 80.5 (2) in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.
The amount of tax payable under subsection (2) by a person in relation to tangible personal property is reduced by the total of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount of tax under section 80 payable or previously paid by the person in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under this Act;

the amount of tax under the Social Service Tax Act previously paid by the person or the contractor in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person or the contractor has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund under that Act;

the amount of tax under section 165 (2), 212.1 or 218.1 or Division IV.1 of Part IX of the Excise Tax Act, in respect of British Columbia as a participating province under Part IX of that Act, previously paid by the person or the contractor in relation to the tangible personal property and for which the person or the contractor has not obtained and is not entitled to obtain a refund, credit or rebate under Part IX of that Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the contractor uses the tangible personal property in a manner such that the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Evidence for purposes of sections 79, 80.2 and 80.5

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of sections 79 (1) and (2), 80.2 (1) and 80.5 (6), evidence that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under this Act in relation to the tangible personal property must be in the form of one of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a signed agreement between the parties that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: sets out the purchase price of the tangible personal property,
expressly identifies the particular provision of this Act under which the tax is imposed, and
expressly states that the person is liable for the tax;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an invoice signed by the parties that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: lists the tangible personal property,
expressly identifies the particular provision of this Act under which the tax is imposed, and
expressly states that the person is liable for the tax;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a declaration in a form acceptable to the director that the parties have agreed that the person is liable for the tax.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), any document other than a document described in subsection (1) does not constitute evidence that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under this Act in relation to the tangible personal property.

If a contract referred to in this Division is entered into between April 1, 2013 and February 22, 2022, any document that contains information that, to the satisfaction of the director, is substantially similar to that described in subsection (1) constitutes evidence that the contractor and the person with whom the contractor has entered into the contract have agreed that the person is liable for tax imposed under this Act in relation to the tangible personal property.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repealed
Tax if change in use of property acquired for resale

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property for resale and becomes, for any period, a user of that property, the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of that property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Subsection (1) does not apply to a person if, when the person becomes a user of the tangible personal property, the tangible personal property is used for a purpose for which the tangible personal property would have been exempt from tax under this Act if the tangible personal property were to be used for that purpose when the person purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia that tangible personal property.

Subsection (1) does not apply to a person in respect of a taxable conveyance, as defined in section 59, if section 64 [tax if change in use of conveyance acquired for resale] applies to the person in respect of the taxable conveyance.
Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first becomes a user of the tangible personal property.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if property used for new purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 87 [tax if recording exhibited], if a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under this Act because the property was to be used for a particular purpose, and
subsequently uses that property, or allows that property to be used, for a purpose other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the particular purpose, or
another purpose for which that property would be exempt from tax under this Act if that property were to be used for that purpose,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of that property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Subsection (1) does not apply to a person in relation to tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under section 142 (1) or (2.1) [exemptions for tangible personal property intended for lease] if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the only subsequent use of that property, other than leasing it, is occasionally, under an agreement, supplying the property with a person to operate it, and
the tangible personal property is capitalized as lease inventory in the person's business accounting records.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses that property, or allows that property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b).
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if leased property used for new purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2) and section 87 [tax if recording exhibited], this section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: leased tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under this Act because the tangible personal property was to be used for a particular purpose, and
subsequently uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, for a purpose other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the particular purpose, or
another purpose for which that tangible personal property would be exempt from tax under this Act if that tangible personal property were to be used for that purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person in relation to tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under section 142 (2) [exemption for tangible personal property intended for re-lease] if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the only subsequent use of that tangible personal property, other than leasing it, is occasionally, under an agreement, supplying the tangible personal property with a person to operate it, and
the tangible personal property is capitalized as lease inventory in the person's business accounting records.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government, in respect of each rental period, under the lease, that includes or begins after the date that the person first uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b), tax on the lease price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 35 [rates of tax in relation to lease price].
For the purposes of subsection (3), the lease price of the tangible personal property is,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to the rental period that includes the date that the person first uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b), that portion of the lease price of the tangible personal property that is attributable to that portion of the rental period that begins on that date and ends at the end of that rental period, or

in relation to a rental period that begins after the date that the person first uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b), that portion of the lease price of the tangible personal property that is attributable to that rental period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tax payable under subsection (3) in respect of the rental period referred to in subsection (4) (a) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b).
Tax payable under subsection (3) in respect of a rental period referred to in subsection (4) (b) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the rental periods ends.
Despite subsections (5) and (6), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on parts or material if property containing parts or material used for new purpose

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property that is a part or material if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the part or material exempt under a prescribed provision of the regulations from tax under this Act because the part or material is to be used in relation to tangible personal property that would be exempt from tax under this Act if the tangible personal property were to be used for a particular purpose, and
subsequently uses that tangible personal property, or allows that tangible personal property to be used, for a purpose other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the particular purpose, or
another purpose for which the part or material would be exempt from tax under this Act if that tangible personal property were to be used for that purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the part or material at the applicable rate under section 34.

Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses the tangible personal property, or allows the tangible personal property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b).
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if conditions for exemption not maintained for specified period

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property that was exempt under a prescribed provision of the regulations from tax under this Act,
the prescribed provision of the regulations requires specified conditions to be maintained for a specified period, and
those conditions are not maintained for that period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.
Tax payable under subsection (2) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the conditions referred to in subsection (1) are not maintained.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (2) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of vehicle, boat or aircraft exempt from tax under Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, designated property has the same meaning as in the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act, as that Act read on March 31, 2013.
This section applies to a person in relation to tangible personal property that is designated property if the person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia the designated property in respect of which tax was not payable under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act, other than by reason of an exemption under section 26 of that Act, and

subsequently uses that property, or allows that property to be used, for a purpose other than a purpose for which that property would be exempt from tax under this Act if that property were to be used for that purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the designated property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Tax payable under subsection (3) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses the property, or allows the property to be used, as referred to in subsection (2) (b).
Despite subsection (4), tax payable under subsection (3) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of property acquired for lease

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under section 142 (4) or (5) [exemptions for tangible personal property intended for lease], and
subsequently ceases to capitalize that property as lease inventory in the person's business accounting records,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of that property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first ceases to capitalize that property as lease inventory in the person's business accounting records.
Despite subsection (2), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of resulting tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) or (b), and

becomes, for any period, a user of the tangible personal property to which the tangible personal property referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection is processed, fabricated or manufactured into, attached to or incorporated into,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of the tangible personal property referred to in paragraph (a) at the applicable rate under section 34.

Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first becomes a user of the tangible personal property first mentioned in subsection (1) (b).
Despite subsection (2), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if dealer or manufacturer changes use of motor vehicle

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: dealer means a person who is registered as a motor dealer under the Motor Dealer Act;
eligible use means a use referred to in paragraph (a) (ii) and (iii) of the definition of "use";
manufacturer means a person who makes motor vehicles but does not include a dealer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a dealer purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia a prescribed motor vehicle for resale or for the purpose of leasing the motor vehicle to other persons and, in a month, uses that motor vehicle in British Columbia only for a prescribed use, in addition to an eligible use, the dealer must pay to the government tax calculated in accordance with the regulations.

If a dealer in a month uses only for a prescribed use, in addition to an eligible use, a prescribed motor vehicle into which tangible personal property exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) has been processed, fabricated, manufactured or incorporated, or to which tangible personal property exempt from tax under that section has been attached, the dealer must pay to the government tax calculated in accordance with the regulations.

If a manufacturer brought or sent into British Columbia, or received delivery of in British Columbia, a prescribed motor vehicle for sale or for the purpose of leasing the motor vehicle to other persons and, in a month, uses that motor vehicle in British Columbia only for a prescribed use, in addition to an eligible use, the manufacturer must pay to the government tax calculated in accordance with the regulations.

If a manufacturer in a month uses only for a prescribed use, in addition to an eligible use, a prescribed motor vehicle into which tangible personal property exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (a) has been processed, fabricated, manufactured or incorporated, or to which tangible personal property exempt from tax under that section has been attached, the manufacturer must pay to the government tax calculated in accordance with the regulations.
Tax payable under subsections (2) to (5) must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

A dealer or manufacturer who must pay tax under subsection (2) or (4) is exempt from tax imposed under section 81 or 82 in relation to the use of the motor vehicle that is subject to tax under this section.

A dealer or manufacturer who must pay tax under subsection (3) or (5) is exempt from tax imposed under section 84 in relation to the use of the motor vehicle that is subject to tax under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of prototype

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: purchased in British Columbia, brought or sent into British Columbia or received delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property that was exempt from tax under section 141 (1) (d) or (e), and
for any period after the testing of the prototype or copy of the prototype referred to under section 141 (1) (d) or (e),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: becomes the user of that prototype or copy of that prototype, or
becomes entitled to receive consideration for use of that prototype or copy of that prototype,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price of that tangible personal property at the applicable rate under section 34.

Subsection (1) does not apply if the only use of the prototype or copy of the prototype is for demonstration and the only consideration received for the use of that prototype or copy of that prototype does not exceed the actual cost of that demonstration.
Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the earliest of the following occurs:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person first becomes a user of the prototype or copy of the prototype;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype is paid;
the consideration for use of the prototype or copy of the prototype becomes due.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (3), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if change in use of property for which refund received under taxation agreement

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: received a refund of tax under section 155 [refund in accordance with Nisg̱a'a Nation Taxation Agreement] or 156 [refund in accordance with treaty first nation tax treatment agreement] in relation to tangible personal property, and
subsequently uses that property, or allows that property to be used, for a purpose other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a purpose that would entitle the person to receive a refund of tax under section 155 or 156, or
another purpose for which that property would be exempt from tax under this Act if that property were to be used for that purpose,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must pay to the government tax on the purchase price or lease price, as the case may be, at the applicable rate under section 34 [rates of tax in relation to purchase price] or 35 [rates of tax in relation to lease price].

Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the person first uses that property, or allows that property to be used, as referred to in subsection (1) (b).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if recording exhibited

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: who brought or sent into British Columbia, received delivery of in British Columbia, purchased or leased, exempt from tax under section 143 (b) (ii), tangible personal property that is a recording of a motion picture, and
who exhibits the motion picture in a movie theatre or other public venue
