bcl:subsection.bcl:text: must pay to the government tax in an amount equal to the amount of tax under this Act that would have otherwise been payable if the person had acquired the right or authority to exhibit the motion picture from a willing lessor acting in good faith in an arm's length transaction in the open market.
Tax payable under subsection (1) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the motion picture is exhibited.
Despite subsection (2), tax payable under subsection (1) by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if leased tangible personal property becomes part of real property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, during the term of a lease of tangible personal property, the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law, then

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tangible personal property is deemed to be sold at a retail sale immediately before the tangible personal property ceases to be personal property,
the person leasing the tangible personal property to the lessee is deemed to be the seller of the tangible personal property,
the lessee must pay tax imposed under section 37 as if the lessee were a purchaser of that tangible personal property, and
the purchase price of the tangible personal property is deemed to be the fair market value of the tangible personal property at the time of the sale.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a sale is deemed to have occurred under subsection (1) (a), the deemed purchaser may not claim an exemption under section 142 (1), (2) or (2.1).

Tax payable under section 37 in accordance with this section must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law.
Despite subsection (3), tax payable under section 37 in accordance with this section by a registrant must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the tangible personal property becomes affixed machinery when the tangible personal property is used so that it ceases to be personal property at common law.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Tangible Personal Property Acquired by Small Seller

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on acquisition of eligible tangible personal property

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A small seller who purchases, at a sale in British Columbia, eligible tangible personal property for resale must pay tax imposed under section 37 [tax on purchase] on the purchase of the eligible tangible personal property as if the small seller were a purchaser of that eligible tangible personal property.

Tangible personal property referred to in sections 141 (1) (a), (b) and (c) [exemptions in relation to industry and commerce] and 143 [exemption in relation to recording of motion picture or audio production] and in prescribed provisions of the regulations is not exempt from tax imposed under this Part when that tangible personal property is purchased by a small seller who must pay tax in accordance with subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on eligible tangible personal property brought into British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a small seller who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, eligible tangible personal property for resale, and
does not pay tax under section 55 in relation to the eligible tangible personal property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person in relation to eligible tangible personal property if the person is required to pay tax or is exempt from tax under section 89 in relation to the eligible tangible personal property.

A small seller to whom this section applies must pay tax imposed under section 49 on the eligible tangible personal property as if the small seller were a person to whom section 49 applies in relation to that eligible tangible personal property.

Tangible personal property referred to in sections 141 (1) (a), (b) and (c) [exemption in relation to industry and commerce] and 143 [exemption in relation to recording of motion picture or audio production] and in prescribed provisions of the regulations is not exempt from tax imposed under this Part when the tangible personal property is brought or sent into British Columbia by, or delivered in British Columbia to, a small seller who must pay tax in accordance with subsection (3) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption in relation to eligible tangible personal property purchased from small seller
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a purchaser purchases eligible tangible personal property from a small seller, the purchaser is exempt from tax imposed under section 37 [tax on purchase] on that purchase.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on purchase of energy product

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A purchaser who purchases an energy product at a sale in British Columbia must pay to the government, for the raising of revenue for the purposes of the Innovative Clean Energy Fund special account established by the Special Accounts Appropriation and Control Act, tax at the rate of 0.4% of the purchase price of the energy product.

If a collector sells an energy product at a sale in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the energy product is being purchased for resale, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (1) as if the person were a purchaser and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (1) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax if energy product brought into British Columbia for use

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), this section applies to a person in relation to an energy product if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, an energy product for use or consumption

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident,
by another person at the BC resident's expense,
by a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent, or
by another person at the expense of a principal for whom the BC resident acts as agent,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person is a BC resident and a person who is not a BC resident brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, an energy product for use or consumption

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the BC resident, or
by the person who is not a BC resident, or by another person, at the BC resident's expense, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, an energy product, and
uses the energy product in British Columbia in the course of the person's business, whether or not the business is carried on in British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section does not apply to a person in relation to an energy product if the person is required to pay tax or is exempt from tax under section 92 in relation to the energy product.

A person to whom this section applies must pay to the government, for the raising of revenue for the purposes of the Innovative Clean Energy Fund special account established by the Special Accounts Appropriation and Control Act, tax at the rate of 0.4% of the purchase price of the energy product.

If a collector causes an energy product to be delivered in British Columbia to a person who alleges that the energy product is being purchased for resale, the person must nevertheless pay tax under subsection (3) as if the person were a person to whom this section applies and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under subsection (3) unless the collector obtains, at or before the time the tax is payable,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that person's registration number, or
if that person does not have a registration number, a declaration in a form acceptable to the director from that person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax under this Division is additional tax
bcl:section.bcl:text: Tax imposed under this Division is in addition to any other tax payable under this Part in respect of the energy product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemptions in relation to energy products

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (1.1), fuel, as defined in the Motor Fuel Tax Act, is exempt from tax imposed under this Division.
The exemption under subsection (1) does not apply to propane included within the definition of "energy product".
A person is exempt from paying further tax under this Division in the period beginning on April 1 in one year and ending on March 31 in the next year if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person has already paid in that period at least $100 000 in tax payable under this Division,
the person provides evidence satisfactory to the director that the person has paid at least $100 000 in accordance with paragraph (a), and
the person receives written confirmation from the director that the person has paid at least $100 000 in accordance with paragraph (a).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a collector sells an energy product to a person who alleges that the person is exempt under subsection (2) from paying further tax under this Division, the person must nevertheless pay tax under this Division and the collector must nevertheless levy and collect the tax under this Division unless the collector obtains from that person, at or before the time the tax is payable, a copy of the written confirmation referred to in subsection (2) (c).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refund of excess if maximum tax paid
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the director is satisfied that a person has paid more than the $100 000 in tax payable under this Division in the period described in section 95 (2), the director must refund that excess to the person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Reporting requirements in relation to energy products
bcl:section.bcl:text: If requested by the director or if required under the regulations, a collector must report to the director the amounts of tax under this Division that were required to be collected in relation to the collector's sales of the energy product.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Other Taxes in Relation to Tangible Personal Property

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Liquor sold under liquor permit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If liquor is purchased for sale under a liquor permit, the holder of that permit or the agent of the holder must pay tax imposed under section 37 on the purchase of the liquor as if the holder of that permit or the agent of the holder were a purchaser of that liquor.
If liquor is or is to be purchased for sale under a liquor permit, the holder of that permit or the agent of the holder must, at the time the permit is issued,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: declare the amount of the total proceeds expected from the sale of the liquor at the event that is the subject of the permit, and

pay to the person issuing the permit an amount equal to the tax under section 37 that would be collectable under this Act based on the expected proceeds of the sales less the amount of tax payable in accordance with subsection (1) of this section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the amount of tax payable under section 37 that is collectable by the holder of the permit exceeds the total of the amount paid by the holder of the permit under subsections (1) and (2) (b) of this section, the holder must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: remit to the government an amount equal to the amount of the excess, and
file with the director a return at the time, in the manner and in a form specified by the director.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An amount to be remitted under subsection (3) must be remitted to the government on or before the last day of the month after the month in which the liquor permit expires.

If the director is satisfied that the amount of tax under section 37 collectable by the holder of the liquor permit on the actual sale of the liquor in respect of which payment was made under subsection (2) of this section is less than the amount paid under subsections (1) and (2), the director must refund to the holder an amount that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is, subject to paragraph (b), equal to the amount of the difference less the amount of tax under subsection (1) for which the holder has obtained or is entitled to obtain a refund for returning liquor purchased for sale under the liquor permit, and
does not exceed the amount paid under subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on acquisition of exclusive product by independent sales contractor

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An independent sales contractor who purchases an exclusive product at a sale in British Columbia from a direct seller must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the direct seller's suggested retail price for the exclusive product.

An independent sales contractor of a direct seller who purchases an exclusive product at a sale in British Columbia from another independent sales contractor of the direct seller must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the direct seller's suggested retail price for the exclusive product.

An independent sales contractor who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, an exclusive product acquired from a direct seller must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the direct seller's suggested retail price for the exclusive product.

An independent sales contractor of a direct seller who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, an exclusive product acquired from another independent sales contractor of the direct seller must pay to the government, by paying to the direct seller as agent of the government, tax at the rate of 7% of the direct seller's suggested retail price for the exclusive product.
Subsection (3) or (4) does not apply to an independent sales contractor in relation to an exclusive product if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the independent sales contractor must pay tax imposed under subsection (1) or (2) in relation to that exclusive product, or
the independent sales contractor must pay tax imposed under Division 5 [Property Brought into British Columbia from Outside Canada] in relation to that exclusive product.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Tangible personal property referred to in section 141 (1) (a), (b) and (c) and in prescribed provisions of the regulations is not exempt from tax imposed under this section when acquired by an independent sales contractor who must pay tax in accordance with this section.
Tax payable under subsection (4) must be paid on or before the last day of the month after the month that includes the entry date of the exclusive product.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on gift of vehicle, boat or aircraft given in British Columbia

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, charity and registrant have the same meaning as in Part IX of the Excise Tax Act.

If a person receives a gift of a vehicle, boat or aircraft and the gift is received in British Columbia, subject to subsections (2) and (3), the person must pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under subsection (4), (4.1), (6), (7) or (8).
Subject to subsection (1.2), subsection (1.3) applies to a person who registers a vehicle under the vehicle registration legislation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the person received the vehicle in British Columbia as a gift on or after July 1, 2010 and before April 1, 2013, or

the person received the vehicle outside British Columbia as a gift, the vehicle was brought or sent into British Columbia on or after July 1, 2010 and before April 1, 2013 and tax was not paid and is not payable under the Consumption Tax Rebate and Transition Act by that person in relation to the vehicle.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1.3) does not apply if any of the following apply in relation to the gift:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provision of the gift is a taxable supply under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act by a registrant;
the provision of the gift is an exempt supply under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act by a registrant that is a charity;
the donor who gave the gift acquired the vehicle in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom this subsection applies must pay to the government tax at the rate of 12% of the fair market value of the vehicle on the date the vehicle was received in British Columbia as a gift or on the entry date of the vehicle.
A person is not required to pay tax under this section in respect of a vehicle, boat or aircraft if the person has paid tax in respect of the vehicle, boat or aircraft under section 49.

This section does not apply in relation to a vehicle, boat or aircraft that is subject to tax or exempt from tax under Division 6 [Conveyances Used Interjurisdictionally] or 7 [Multijurisdictional Vehicles].

Subject to subsections (4.1), (6), (7) and (8), the rate of tax payable under subsection (1) on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 12% of the fair market value of the vehicle, boat or aircraft on the date the vehicle, boat or aircraft is received as a gift.
Subject to subsections (6) to (8), the rate of tax payable under subsection (1) on a passenger vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 12% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsections (6) to (8) apply if any of the following apply in relation to the gift:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the provision of the gift is a taxable supply under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act by a registrant;
the provision of the gift is an exempt supply under Part IX of the Excise Tax Act by a registrant that is a charity;
the donor who gave the gift acquired the vehicle, boat or aircraft in prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsections (7) and (8), the rate of tax payable under subsection (1) on a vehicle, boat or aircraft is 7% of the fair market value of the vehicle, boat or aircraft on the date the vehicle, boat or aircraft is received as a gift.
The rate of tax payable under subsection (1) on a passenger vehicle, other than a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle, is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is less than $55 000;
8% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $55 000 or more but less than $56 000;
9% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $56 000 or more but less than $57 000;
10% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $57 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the passenger vehicle on the date the passenger vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The rate of tax payable under subsection (1) on a passenger vehicle that is a zero-emission vehicle is as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 7% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is less than $75 000;
8% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $75 000 or more but less than $76 000;
9% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $76 000 or more but less than $77 000;
10% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $77 000 or more but less than $125 000;
15% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $125 000 or more but less than $150 000;
20% of the fair market value of the zero-emission vehicle on the date the vehicle is received as a gift, if the fair market value is $150 000 or more.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on reusable containers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), a person who purchases a reusable container at a sale in British Columbia must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the purchase price of the reusable container.

Subject to subsections (3) and (4), a person who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, a reusable container must pay to the government tax at the rate of 7% of the purchase price of the reusable container.
Subsection (1) or (2) applies to a person in relation to the reusable container if the person intends to sell a product that is packaged or delivered in or on the reusable container and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reusable container is subject to a deposit, credit, penalty or replacement charge to encourage its return for reuse as a container,
the person retains an interest in the reusable container after the sale of the product,
the reusable container, or a similar reusable container, is required to be returned to the person after the sale of the product, or

the product is sold in a jurisdiction where the reusable container is subject to a regulatory or contractual scheme to recover the container for reuse by the person or by other participants in the scheme.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a person in relation to a reusable container if the person is required to pay tax or is exempt from tax under subsection (1) in relation to that reusable container.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on leased property occasionally supplied with operator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than a person who has paid tax under section 82 [tax if property used for new purpose] or 83 [tax if change in use of property acquired for lease], who purchases tangible personal property exempt from tax under section 142 (4), or who brings or sends into British Columbia, or receives delivery of in British Columbia, tangible personal property exempt from tax under section 142 (5), must, when the property is, under an agreement, supplied with a person to operate it, pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under section 35 [rates of tax in relation to lease price] as if the price at which that property would have been leased had it been leased without supplying a person to operate it were the lease price of the tangible personal property.
If

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person, other than a person who has paid tax under section 82 or 83, purchases in British Columbia, brings or sends into British Columbia or receives delivery of in British Columbia tangible personal property exempt from tax under section 142 (1), (2) or (2.1),
the only subsequent use of that tangible personal property, other than leasing it, is occasionally, under an agreement, supplying the property with a person to operate it, and
the tangible personal property is capitalized as lease inventory in the person's business accounting records,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person must, when the property is, under an agreement, supplied with a person to operate it, pay to the government tax at the applicable rate under section 35 as if the price at which that property would have been leased had it been leased without supplying a person to operate it were the lease price of the tangible personal property.
Tax payable under subsection (1) or (2) must be paid on or before the prescribed date and in the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Tax on subsequent purchase or lease after refund or credit

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, related individual includes a sibling.

If a purchaser is paid a refund or allowed a credit of tax paid under this Act in respect of tangible personal property that is returned or resold to the collector who sold it to the purchaser and that tangible personal property is subsequently purchased or leased by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the purchaser,
a related individual of the purchaser, or
an associated corporation of the purchaser,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the person referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), as the case may be, must pay to the government, in lieu of the tax payable, if any, under Division 2 or 3 of this Part in respect of that tangible personal property, tax equal to the tax that was refunded or credited to the purchaser.
For the purposes of applying the other provisions of this Act in relation to a tax imposed under subsection (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tax is deemed to be a tax imposed under section 37,
if the tangible personal property is leased, the time of entering into the lease is deemed to be the time of purchase,
section 34 and Part 6 do not apply, and
prescribed provisions of the regulations do not apply.
